title: Normality, deviance and minor psychiatric morbidity in the community – a re-interpretation
abstract: Synopsis Anderson et al. (1993) presented two models of psychiatric morbidity that they claimed represented ‘individual’-based and ‘community’-based explanations. They used data from the Health and Lifestyle Survey to test the models and concluded that the data support a ‘community’-based explanation. Their deductions from the models appear to be flawed, nevertheless, their conclusion may be valid.
